xxl.core.io.converters

Class AsciiStringConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.io.converters.Converter<String>
      • xxl.core.io.converters.AsciiStringConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class AsciiStringConverter
extends Converter<String>
    This class provides a converter that is able to read and write String objects as streams of ASCII characters (the byte values representing the ASCII characters). In addition to the read and write methods that read or write String objects (these methods get Objects and cast them to String objects) this class contains readAsciiString and writeAsciiString methods that gets directly String objects.

    Note: Streams of ASCII characters (representing String objects) are separated by special delimiters. Those delimiters are sequences of one or more ASCII characters, that can be specified by the user. When a stream (especially the last of a data input) is not delimited by one of the specified delimiters, it cannot be read by this converter.

    Example usage (1). 

       // create a new AsciiStringConverter that uses "\r\n" (cariage return, line feed),
   // "\t" (horizontal tab) and " " (white space) as delimiters

   AsciiStringConverter converter = new AsciiStringConverter(
       new String[] {
           "\r\n",
           "\t",
           " "
       }
   );

   // create a byte array output stream

   ByteArrayOutputStream output = new ByteArrayOutputStream();

   // write some strings (delimited by "\r\n" per default) to the output stream

   converter.write(
       new DataOutputStream(output),
       "Far out in the uncharted backwaters of the unfashionable end of the western spiral
        arm of the Galaxy lies a small unregarded yellow sun."
   );
   converter.write(
       new DataOutputStream(output),
       "Orbiting this at a distance of roughly ninety-two million miles is an utterly
        insignificant little blue green planet whose ape-descended life forms are so
        amazingly primitive that they still think digital watches are a pretty neat idea."
   );

   // create a byte array input stream on the output stream

   ByteArrayInputStream input = new ByteArrayInputStream(output.toByteArray());

   // read strings from the input stream and print them as long as the stream contains data

   while (input.available() > 0)
       System.out.println(converter.read(new DataInputStream(input)));

   // close the streams after use

   input.close();
   output.close();

    See Also:
    DataInput, DataOutput, IOException, Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected CharacterConverter converter
      The converter that is used for converting single Character objects into ASCII characters and vice versa.
      protected String[] delimiters
      An array of delimiters that can be used to separate the converted String objects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsciiStringConverter

        public AsciiStringConverter(CharacterConverter converter,
                            String... delimiters)
        Constructs a new ASCII string converter that uses the given converter for converting single Character objects into ASCII characters and vice versa. The specified array contains the delimiters that can be used to separate the converted String objects.
        Parameters:
        converter - the converter that is used for converting single Character objects into ASCII characters and vice versa.
        delimiters - an array of delimiters that can be used to separate the converted String objects.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no delimiters are specified.

      • AsciiStringConverter

        public AsciiStringConverter(String... delimiters)
        Constructs a new ASCII string converter that uses a default converter for converting single Character objects into ASCII characters and vice versa. The specified array contains the delimiters that can be used to separate the converted String objects.

        This constructor is equivalent to the call of new AsciiStringConverter(AsciiConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, delimiters).

        Parameters:
        delimiters - an array of delimiters that can be used to separate the converted String objects.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no delimiters are specified.

      • AsciiStringConverter

        public AsciiStringConverter(CharacterConverter converter)
        Constructs a new ASCII string converter that uses the given converter for converting single Character objects into ASCII characters and vice versa. Cariage return and line feed are used as delimiters.

        This constructor is equivalent to the call of new AsciiStringConverter(converter, new String[] {"\r", "\n"}).

        Parameters:
        converter - the converter that is used for converting single Character objects into ASCII characters and vice versa.

      • AsciiStringConverter

        public AsciiStringConverter()
        Constructs a new ASCII string converter that uses a default converter for converting single Character objects into ASCII characters and vice versa. Cariage return and line feed are used as delimiters.

        This constructor is equivalent to the call of new AsciiStringConverter(AsciiConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, new String [] {"\r", "\n"}).

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public String read(DataInput dataInput,
                   String object)
            throws IOException
        Reads in a string of ASCII characters and returns the restored (String) object, when a delimiter is found. When a string (especially the last) is not delimited by one of the specified delimiters, this method will expect more data and therefore an EOFException will be thrown.

        This implementation ignores the specified object, so it does not matter when the specified object is null.

        Specified by:
        read in class Converter<String>
        Parameters:
        dataInput - the stream to read the ASCII characters representing a string from in order to return a String object.
        object - the (String) object to be restored. In this implementation it is ignored.
        Returns:
        the read String object.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur.

      • readAsciiString

        public String readAsciiString(DataInput dataInput)
                       throws IOException
        Reads in a string of ASCII characters and returns the restored (String) object, when a delimiter is found.

        This implementation calls the read method and casts its result to String.

        Parameters:
        dataInput - the stream to read the ASCII characters representing a string from in order to return a String object.
        Returns:
        the read String object.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur.

      • write

        public void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                  String object,
                  int index)
           throws IOException
        Writes the specified String object to the specified data output by writing a string of ASCII characters to it. The string is delimited by the delimiter the given index points to.
        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write a string of ASCII characters representing the specified String object to.
        object - the String object that should be written to the data output.
        index - the index of the delimiter that should be used to delimit the converted string.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

      • write

        public void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                  String object)
           throws IOException
        Writes the specified String object to the specified data output by writing a string of ASCII characters to it.

        This implementation calls the write method with the given data output, the specified object and index 0. That means, the first delimiter of the array will be used to delimit the string per default.

        Specified by:
        write in class Converter<String>
        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write a string of ASCII characters representing the specified String object to.
        object - the String object that should be written to the data output.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

      • writeAsciiString

        public void writeAsciiString(DataOutput dataOutput,
                             String object,
                             int index)
                      throws IOException
        Writes the specified String object to the specified data output by writing a string of ASCII characters to it.

        This implementation calls the write method with the given data output, the specified object and the given index.

        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write a string of ASCII characters representing the specified String object to.
        object - the String object that should be written to the data output.
        index - the index of the delimiter that should be used to delimit the converted string.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

      • writeAsciiString

        public void writeAsciiString(DataOutput dataOutput,
                             String object)
                      throws IOException
        Writes the specified String object to the specified data output by writing a string of ASCII characters to it.

        This implementation calls the write method with the given data output, the specified object and index 0. That means, the first delimiter of the array will be used to delimit the string per default.

        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write a string of ASCII characters representing the specified String object to.
        object - the String object that should be written to the data output.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

      • endsWithDelimiter

        protected int endsWithDelimiter(String buffer)
        Determines whether the specified String object ends with one of the delimiters stored in the array. The index of the delimiter in the array is returned, if the string is delimited by it, else -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the string that should be tested whether it ends with one of the specified delimiters.
        Returns:
        the index of the delimiter in the array, if the string is delimited by it, else -1.
